item.title: Threat Hunting Platform | C2 & Malicious Infrastructure Hunting
item.description: Explore the leading Threat Hunting Platform, discover active C2 servers, perform proactive infrastructure hunting and more.

item.title: Threat Hunting Platform | C2 & Malicious Infrastructure Hunting
item.description: Explore the leading Threat Hunting Platform, discover active C2 servers, perform proactive infrastructure hunting and more.

item.title: Uncovering Threat Actor Tactics: How Open Directories Provide Insight into XWorm Delivery Strategies
item.description: Learn how threat actors leverage open directories to deliver XWorm malware disguised as popular software, providing insight into their tactics.

item.title: Rare Watermark Links Cobalt Strike 4.10 Team Servers to Ongoing Suspicious Activity
item.description: Uncover the infrastructure and learn how a unique watermark led to the discovery of Cobalt Strike 4.10 team servers impersonating well-known brands.

item.title: MoqHao Leverages iCloud and VK in Campaign Targeting Apple IDs and Android Device
item.description: Discover how the MoqHao campaign leveraging iCloud and VK employs cross-platform tactics to steal credentials and distribute malicious APKs.

item.title: “Million OK!!!!” and the Naver Facade: Tracking Recent Suspected Kimsuky Infrastructure
item.description: Discover how the 'Million OK!!!' HTTP response linked to Kimsuky reappears on new infrastructure, offering insights into evolving North Korean threats.

item.title: Oyster’s Trail: Resurgence of Infrastructure Linked to Ransomware and Cybercrime Actors
item.description: Our new analysis uncovers domains tied to the Oyster backdoor, suspected Vanilla Tempest links, and insights into server configuration patterns. Learn more.

item.title: Hunt.io 2024 Year in Review: Key Product & Research Highlights
item.description: Discover Hunt.io's 2024 highlights: major product launches, innovations like AttackCapture™, C2 Feed, and Hunt SQL, and a look ahead to 2025.

item.title: Golang Beacons and VS Code Tunnels: Tracking a Cobalt Strike Server Leveraging Trusted Infrastructure
item.description: Discover how a Cobalt Strike server with a TLS certificate and watermark used a Golang beacon to communicate via Visual Studio Code tunnels. Learn more.

item.title: Cyberhaven Extension Compromise: TLS Certificates Reveal Hidden Infrastructure
item.description: Read more about connections through a TLS certificate linking reported and unreported infrastructure tied to the Cyberhaven extension compromise.

item.title: ‘JustJoin’ Landing Page Linked to Suspected DPRK Activity Resurfaces
item.description: Discover a fake “JustJoin” landing page tied to DPRK cyber activity, resurfacing with new infrastructure linked by overlapping SSH keys. Learn more.

item.title: VS Code Extension Impersonating Zoom Targets Google Chrome Cookies
item.description: Uncover a deceptive VS Code extension, masquerading as Zoom, that pilfers your Google Chrome cookies. Join us as we expose the techniques behind this alarming supply chain campaign.

item.title: Suspected KEYPLUG Infrastructure: TLS Certificates and GhostWolf Links
item.description: Uncover how Hunt’s TLS records reveal patterns in suspected KEYPLUG infrastructure, linking GhostWolf and RedGolf/APT41 to ongoing activity.

item.title: Unmasking SparkRAT: Detection & macOS Campaign Insights
item.description: Explore SparkRAT detection tactics, macOS targeting, and insights into recent DPRK-linked campaigns with actionable research findings.

item.title: Unlock SSL Intelligence: How SSL History Boosts Threat Hunting
item.description: Explore how SSL intelligence and SSL history empower proactive threat hunting. Learn tools, real-world examples, and strategies to track cyber threats.

item.title: GreenSpot APT Targets NetEase 163.com Users with Fake Download Pages & Spoofed Domains
item.description: GreenSpot APT targets NetEase 163.com users with fake download pages and domain spoofing. Learn their tactics, risks, and how to protect your email accounts.

item.title: SmokeLoader Malware Targets Ukraine’s Auto & Banking Sectors via Open Directories
item.description: Attackers used open directories to spread SmokeLoader malware, luring Ukraine’s auto and banking sectors. Explore findings, execution, and tactics.

item.title: Tracking Pyramid C2: Identifying Post-Exploitation Servers in Hunt
item.description: Discover how Pyramid, an open-source tool, enables post-exploitation. Learn detection methods using HTTP headers and recent findings in Hunt.

item.title: Advanced Threat Hunting with New SSL Features: Unlocking HuntSQL™ Anomaly Flags for Deeper Detection
item.description: Hunt.io enhances SSL threat hunting with new anomaly flags in HuntSQL™, improving the detection of misconfigurations, expired certificates, and malware infrastructure.

item.title: Malicious Signal, Line, and Gmail Installers Target Chinese-Speaking Users with Backdoors
item.description: Read how attackers distribute backdoored Signal, Line, and Gmail installers through fraudulent download pages and how to defend against this campaign.

item.title: LightSpy Malware Now Targets Facebook & Instagram Data
item.description: A new LightSpy server expands its attack scope, targeting Facebook and Instagram database files. Explore its evolving capabilities and infrastructure.

item.title: Uncovering Joker’s C2 Network: How Hunt’s SSL History Exposed Its Infrastructure
item.description: Discover Joker malware infrastructure with Hunt SSL History, mapping its C2 network through certificate tracking of recent and past activity.

item.title: Exposing the Deception: Russian EFF Impersonators Behind Stealc & Pyramid C2
item.description: Discover how an open directory exposed a threat actor impersonating EFF to target gamers and how we mapped their infrastructure to Stealc & Pyramid C2.

item.title: Introducing Hunt 2.0: Deeper Threat Analysis & Enhanced Data for Cyber Intelligence
item.description: Our latest release delivers deeper threat analysis with improved threat actor, C2, malware data, and new integrations for robust cyber intelligence.

item.title: JSPSpy and ‘Filebroser’: A Custom File Management Tool in Webshell Infrastructure
item.description: Discover how threat actors deploy a rebranded File Browser alongside JSPSpy for stealth file management on compromised servers.

item.title: South Korean Organizations Targeted by Cobalt Strike ‘Cat’ Delivered by a Rust Beacon
item.description: Discover how threat actors used a Rust loader to deploy Cobalt Strike ‘Cat’ against South Korean targets. Learn more.

item.title: Introducing IOC Hunter Feed and Attribution for Enhanced Threat Intelligence
item.description: Track threat actors and malicious infrastructure with Hunt.io’s IOC Hunter Feed and C2 Attribution. Get deeper visibility and context for better threat intelligence.

item.title: A Practical Guide to Uncovering Malicious Infrastructure With Hunt.io
item.description: Learn how to track and map adversary infrastructure using Hunt, pivoting from a single IP to uncover hidden connections through infrastructure overlaps and key intelligence indicators.

item.title: URLx Just Got Bigger: 10.6B URLs for Recon and Malicious Infrastructure Hunting
item.description: Explore exposed infrastructure with URLx: 10.6B+ URLs, HTTPx integration, and advanced filtering - now live in Hunt.io.

item.title: Russian-Speaking Threat Actor Abuses Cloudflare & Telegram in Phishing Campaign
item.description: Learn how a Russian-speaking threat actor has evolved from impersonating EFF to now deploying Cloudflare-themed phishing with Telegram-based C2.

item.title: Proactive ClickFix Threat Hunting with Hunt.io
item.description: Learn how Hunt.io identifies early-stage ClickFix delivery pages across the web using advanced search capabilities to stay ahead of exploitation attempts.

item.title: Hunt.io Insights: Gamaredon’s Flux-Like Infrastructure and a Look at Recent ShadowPad Activity
item.description: Explore Gamaredon’s flux-like DNS and ShadowPad malware infrastructure, with insights into how these attacker networks are configured, rotated, and maintained.

item.title: Server-Side Phishing: How Credential Theft Campaigns Are Hiding in Plain Sight
item.description: Phishing campaign evades detection with server-side logic. See how employee portals are targeted—and how defenders can uncover them. Learn more.

item.title: KeyPlug Server Exposes Fortinet Exploits & Webshell Activity Targeting a Major Japanese Company
item.description: Briefly exposed KeyPlug infrastructure revealed Fortinet exploits, encrypted webshells, and recon scripts targeting Shiseido, a major Japanese enterprise. Learn more..

item.title: Introducing Hunt 2.2: AttackCapture™ Zip Extraction, Smarter SQL, IP History Consolidation, and more
item.description: Explore Hunt 2.2: Auto-unpack zips in AttackCapture™, smarter SQL with WHOIS and Nmap, and full IP history consolidation, track abused hosting with Host Radar, and more.

item.title: Inside the 2025 Energy Phishing Wave: Chevron, Conoco, PBF, Phillips 66
item.description: Hunt.io uncovers the 2025 Energy Phishing Wave, with Chevron, Conoco, PBF, and Phillips 66 targeted by large-scale cloning and brand abuse. Learn more.

item.title: AsyncRAT Campaigns Uncovered: How Attackers Abuse ScreenConnect and Open Directories
item.description: Research on AsyncRAT campaigns using trojanized ScreenConnect installers and open directories, exposing resilient attacker infrastructure and C2 tactics. Learn more.

item.title: Hunting C2 Panels: Beginner’s Guide for Identifying Command and Control Dashboards
item.description: Beginner’s guide to hunting exposed C2 dashboards like Supershell, HookBot, Chaos, Unam, Mythic, and Metasploit using paths, titles, and hashes

item.title: Odyssey Stealer & AMOS Hit macOS Developers with Fake Homebrew Sites
item.description: A large-scale macOS malware campaign mimics trusted dev tools to spread Odyssey Stealer and AMOS via fake Homebrew sites. Learn more.

item.title: Multilingual ZIP Phishing Campaigns Targeting Financial and Government Organizations Across Asia
item.description: Hunt.io maps phishing campaigns using shared ZIP payload infrastructure targeting financial institutions and government organizations across Asia. Learn more.

item.title: The Complete Guide to Hunting Cobalt Strike – Part 1: Detecting in Open Directories
item.description: Learn how to detect Cobalt Strike in open directories using AttackCapture™. We analyzed real files, SSL certificates, and servers to uncover live C2 infrastructure.

item.title: Malicious VSCode Extension Launches Multi-Stage Attack Chain with Anivia Loader and OctoRAT
item.description: A fake VSCode extension triggered a multi-stage attack deploying the Anivia loader and OctoRAT. Learn how the chain worked and where defenders can detect it. Learn more.

item.title: React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182): Node.js RCE Against a Production Next.js App
item.description: A detailed analysis of how React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182) was used to launch a multi-stage attack against a production Next.js app, exposing Node.js systems to real-world exploitation techniques and operational C2 infrastructure.

item.title: Inside DPRK Operations: New Lazarus and Kimsuky Infrastructure Uncovered Across Global Campaigns
item.description: Deep investigation into DPRK activity, revealing new Lazarus and Kimsuky infrastructure through multi-stage hunts and exposed operational patterns.

item.title: Inside China’s Hosting Ecosystem: 18,000+ Malware C2 Servers Mapped Across Major ISPs
item.description: Discover how we mapped over 18,000 active malware C2 servers across Chinese ISPs and cloud providers using host-centric telemetry. See which providers are most frequently abused and what it means for global threat monitoring.

item.title: ClickFix Facebook Session Hijacking Campaign Targets Creators at Scale
item.description: An in-depth analysis of a ClickFix phishing campaign hijacking Facebook sessions at scale. Learn how attackers abuse verification workflows, steal session cookies, bypass MFA, and target creators using cloud-hosted infrastructure.

item.title: Exposed BYOB C2 Infrastructure Reveals a Multi-Stage Malware Deployment
item.description: Analysis of an exposed BYOB command-and-control server revealing droppers, stagers, payloads, persistence mechanisms, and supporting infrastructure uncovered through proactive threat hunting

item.title: Hunting OpenClaw Exposures: CVE-2026-25253 in Internet-Facing AI Agent Gateways
item.description: Our research team identified over 17,500 internet-exposed OpenClaw, Clawdbot, and Moltbot instances vulnerable to CVE-2026-25253. This report documents detection methods and infrastructure analysis using Hunt.io

item.title: Fake Homebrew Pages Deliver Cuckoo Stealer via ClickFix | macOS Threat Hunting Analysis
item.description: Technical analysis of a ClickFix campaign delivering Cuckoo Stealer through fake Homebrew typosquat domains. Includes infrastructure pivots, HuntSQL queries, C2 details, persistence, and more.

item.title: Reimagining Hunt.io: Built around our infrastructure-first approach to threat intelligence.
item.description: We’ve launched the new Hunt.io website, reflecting our infrastructure-first platform, stronger OEM focus, and improved investigation workflows.
